intro: Brunia staavioides, commonly known as the silverleaf brunia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects.
